Protection.NameOfProject: Improving the lifes of vulnerable returnee- and host community households in Sinuni and Wana sub- districts through the provision of protection services and agricultural support (multi-cluster project)
Protection.Objective: The overall objective of the protection component is to expand general protection services (including legal assistance/counselling, PSS & HLP) to underserved areas with high needs in order to ensure safe and dignified returns and sustainable lives of people living in Arab villages and Neighboring villages in Sinuni Sub district, Sinjar districts.

SGBVActivities.Activity: Non- structured psycho-social support (PSS) activities for children and adolescents
protection needs identified and referred to specialized services
PSS sessions for children to cope their stress and fears during COVID-19
Service providers  trained on GBV prevention and referral
POCs trained on GBV prevention and referral

SGBVHighlights.GeneralHighlights: APM for GBV has attended GBVIMS Data Analysis meeting via Webox which was conducted by GBVIMS coordinator in Erbil. The purpose behind; to discuss the data of GBV cases and discuss the reason behind the inceasing cases especillay in COVID-19.
APM for GBV conducted three days training on Engaging Men Through Accountable Practice  for Harikar/UNHCR SGBV unit in CLC-Domiz camp for ten staff (7 females and 3 males).
APM for GBV conducted PSEA refresher training for thirty-eight Harikar staff in Harikat office.
CLC-Manager has attended monthly protection meeting in camp management office during the meeting all updates from other agency shared with activities and plans for July.
CLC/Gawilan social worker has attended Gawilan protection meeting which was conducted by Gawilan camp management and UNHCR regarding the activities and challenges inside the camp
CLC/ Bardarash staff have participated and attended an event under the name “Last’s altogether handprint to delight the children” the activity was for orphan’s kids in Bardarash camp.
CLC/Bardarash center manager has attended UNHCR online Bardarash protection meeting.
CLC/ Bardarash center manager has attended camp coordination meeting with camp management.
CPO has attended Child Protection Working Group
CPO has attended camp coordination meeting

Provision of water through boreholes operations in Essian camp

care and Maintenance of water network in Essian camp
Care and Maintenance of sanitation facilities in Chamishku camp
Care and Maintenance of sanitation facilities in Essian camp

WASHHighlights.GeneralHighlights: COVID-19 response through home visit awareness that covered its symptoms, prevention, and how to properly wash hands.
Also, 7785 COVID-19 related hygiene kits were distributed. Of which, 4928 in Chamsihku camp and 2857 in Essian camp.
12 borehole operators were trained in both Essian and Chamishku camps on how to conduct FRC tests.
